No Principles:
Arson is a criminal act of deliberately setting fire to buildings, structures, or wildland areas with the intent to cause damage or destruction. It is a serious crime that can result in significant property damage, injury, or loss of life. Arson can be motivated by a variety of factors, including revenge, financial gain, political protest, or personal gratification.

Arson is a felony offense in most jurisdictions, and those convicted of the crime can face severe penalties, including fines, imprisonment, and restitution to the victims. Arson investigations are typically conducted by specialized law enforcement units, often in collaboration with fire departments and insurance companies.

It is important to note that not all cases of setting fires are considered arson. Fires that are set accidentally or without criminal intent are not considered arson. However, if a fire is set intentionally and maliciously, it can be charged as arson.
